message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "Using data from the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys, we investigate the factors that determine firm productivity in sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "Our study relies on a unique dataset combining the Indian Annual Survey of Industries with state-level air pollution data from India's National Air Quality Monitoring Programme.", "dataset": ["Indian Annual Survey of Industries", "India's National Air Quality Monitoring Programme"], "topic": ["Environment"]}, {"sentence": "To examine this issue, we construct a new dataset which combines hourly energy generation data from over 3000 renewable facilities built between 2005 and 2018, with information on climate-grids across the United States.", "dataset": ["hourly energy generation data from over 3000 renewable facilities built between 2005 and 2018", "climate-grids across the United States"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) Food Balance Sheets dataset for food consumption data and multiple rounds of Demographic and Health Surveys from 1996 to 2016 for information on maternal and child characteristics such as women's education, age at first birth, and child health status.", "dataset": ["Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) Food Balance Sheets", "Demographic and Health Surveys"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper examines the role of gender in shaping the impact of trade liberalization using firm-level customs transaction data merged with household survey data.", "dataset": ["firm-level customs transaction data", "household survey data"], "topic": ["Gender", "Trade"]}, {"sentence": "We combine geospatial information with a wealth of household survey data collected in seven African countries under the Living Standards Measurement Study/Integrated Surveys on Agriculture, allowing us to identify communities prone to food insecurity hence vulnerable to climate change and other environmental shocks.", "dataset": ["Living Standards Measurement Study/Integrated Surveys on Agriculture"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "This study uses household-level data from multiple rounds of the Living Standards Measurement Study to examine the relationship between disability status and measures of economic well-being in low- and middle-income countries.", "dataset": ["Living Standards Measurement Study"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "We use a unique dataset covering all international air passengers who entered or exited South Korea to identify some factors that may affect the decision to travel by air during the COVID-19 pandemic.", "dataset": ["international air passengers who entered or exited South Korea"], "topic": ["Transport"]}, {"sentence": "We merge detailed trade data from firm-level exporters across three East African countries with newly available transportation costs by postal code and find significant heterogeneity in the extensive margin response to changes in transportation costs across firms and export destinations within and across countries.", "dataset": ["detailed trade data from firm-level exporters across three East African countries"], "topic": ["Trade", "Transport"]}, {"sentence": "We use fine-grained geolocation information for over 10,000 public schools in Uganda linked to administrative data on teacher attendance, school resources and performance.", "dataset": ["fine-grained geolocation information for over 10,000 public schools in Uganda"], "topic": ["Education"]}]
